Originations
Class Ledger

java.lang.Object
  Originations.Ledger

public class Ledger
extends java.lang.Object

Class to represent the ledger for a single loan instrument. The ledger contains entries which fall into three major buckets: principal, interest and fees.

See Also:
LedgerEntry, LineOfCredit

Constructor Summary
Ledger()
          Initializes the ledger by creating an array of ledger entries.

Constructor Detail

Ledger

public Ledger()

Method Detail

addEntry

public void addEntry(int type,
                     java.lang.String desc,
                     java.util.Date date,
                     double amount,
                     boolean credit)
Books a new ledger entry.

Parameters:
type - denotes the entry type (only LedgerEntry.PRINCIPAL, LedgerEntry.INTEREST and LedgerEntry.FEE are used)
desc - description of entry (e.g. "Monthly fee")
date - post date for an entry
amount - dollar amount of the entry (unsigned)
credit - specifies if the entry is a credit or a debit

size

public int size()
Returns the number of entries in the ledger.

Returns:
number of ledger entries

getPrincipal

public double getPrincipal(java.util.Date date)
Computes the principal balance on the given date by adding up all entries with a principal type until the given date

Parameters:
date - last post date to consider
Returns:
principal balance

sort

public void sort()
Sorts the entries by date. Helper function used in getLastDrawPrincipal(Date).

getLastDrawPrincipal

public double getLastDrawPrincipal(java.util.Date date)
Computes the principal balance at the time of the last draw (i.e. when the last positive principal entry was booked) before the specified date. This is used to compute minimum monthly payment.

Parameters:
date - last post date to consider
Returns:
principal at the time of the last draw

print

public void print()
Prints the ledger to the screen.
